CA1850.fullDescription: It is more efficient to use the static 'HashData' method over creating and managing a HashAlgorithm instance to call 'ComputeHash'.

CA2208.fullDescription: A call is made to the default (parameterless) constructor of an exception type that is or derives from ArgumentException, or an incorrect string argument is passed to a parameterized constructor of an exception type that is or derives from ArgumentException.

CS8618.shortDescription: Non-nullable field must contain a non-null value when exiting constructor. Consider adding the 'required' modifier or declaring as nullable.

S112.shortDescription: General or reserved exceptions should never be thrown
S112.fullDescription: This rule raises an issue when a general or reserved exception is thrown.

S1192.shortDescription: String literals should not be duplicated
S1192.fullDescription: Duplicated string literals make the process of refactoring complex and error-prone, as any change would need to be propagated on all occurrences.

S1199.shortDescription: Nested code blocks should not be used
S1199.fullDescription: Nested code blocks create new scopes where variables declared within are inaccessible from the outside, and their lifespan ends with the block.

S125.shortDescription: Sections of code should not be commented out
S125.fullDescription: Commented-out code distracts the focus from the actual executed code. It creates a noise that increases maintenance code. And because it is never executed, it quickly becomes out of date and invalid.

S1450.shortDescription: Private fields only used as local variables in methods should become local variables
S1450.fullDescription: When the value of a private field is always assigned to in a class' methods before being read, then it is not being used to store class information. Therefore, it should become a local variable in the relevant methods to prevent any misunderstanding.

S2068.fullDescription: Because it is easy to extract strings from an application source code or binary, credentials should not be hard-coded. This is particularly true for applications that are distributed or that are open-source.

S2436.shortDescription: Types and methods should not have too many generic parameters
S2436.fullDescription: A method or class with too many type parameters has likely aggregated too many responsibilities and should be split.

S2933.shortDescription: Fields that are only assigned in the constructor should be "readonly"
S2933.fullDescription: readonly fields can only be assigned in a class constructor. If a class has a field that’s not marked readonly but is only set in the constructor, it could cause confusion about the field’s intended use. To avoid confusion, such fields should be marked readonly to make their intended use explicit, and to prevent future maintainers from inadvertently changing their use.

S3442.fullDescription: The abstract modifier in a class declaration is used to indicate that a class is intended only to be a base class of other classes, not instantiated on its own.

S3928.shortDescription: Parameter names used into ArgumentException constructors should match an existing one
S3928.fullDescription: Some constructors of the ArgumentException, ArgumentNullException, ArgumentOutOfRangeException and DuplicateWaitObjectException classes must be fed with a valid parameter name. This rule raises an issue in two cases:

S6580.shortDescription: Use a format provider when parsing date and time
S6580.fullDescription: When converting a string representation of a date and time to a DateTime object or any other temporal type with one of the available system parsing methods, you should always provide an IFormatProvider parameter.

S6608.shortDescription: Prefer indexing instead of "Enumerable" methods on types implementing "IList"
S6608.fullDescription: Indexes in C# provide direct access to an element at a specific position within an array or collection. When compared to Enumerable methods, indexing can be more efficient for certain scenarios, such as iterating over a large collection, due to avoiding the overhead of checking the underlying collection type before accessing it.

S6781.shortDescription: JWT secret keys should not be disclosed
S6781.fullDescription: Secret leaks often occur when a sensitive piece of authentication data is stored with the source code of an application. Considering the source code is intended to be deployed across multiple assets, including source code repositories or application hosting servers, the secrets might get exposed to an unintended audience.

S6964.shortDescription: Value type property used as input in a controller action should be nullable, required or annotated with the JsonRequiredAttribute to avoid under-posting.
S6964.fullDescription: "Under-posting" refers to a situation where a client sends less data than expected to the server during an HTTP request, for example when the client omits some properties from the request body that the server expects to receive.

S6966.fullDescription: In an async method, any blocking operations should be avoided.

S927.shortDescription: Parameter names should match base declaration and other partial definitions
S927.fullDescription: Parameters are part of the method signature and its identity.
